#### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe

It is not immediately obvious to new users how to best manage resources with R2DBC, see e.g. my previous message:
https://groups.google.com/g/r2dbc/c/a7CQAU_u_m0

The example on the website is no help either, as it produces a resources leak:
https://r2dbc.io

The `Connection` is never closed:

```java
ConnectionFactory connectionFactory = ConnectionFactories
  .get("r2dbc:h2:mem:///testdb");

Mono.from(connectionFactory.create())
  .flatMapMany(connection -> connection
    .createStatement("SELECT firstname FROM PERSON WHERE age > $1")
    .bind("$1", 42)
    .execute())
  .flatMap(result -> result
    .map((row, rowMetadata) -> row.get("firstname", String.class)))
  .doOnNext(System.out::println)
  .subscribe();
```

The same problem in https://github.com/r2dbc/r2dbc-pool/blob/main/README.md, where the resource is closed, but it is left as an exercise to the reader how to actually do that in a reactive stream:

```java
// later

Connection connection = ‚Ä¶;
Mono<Void> release = connection.close(); // released the connection back to the pool
```

Given the trouble discussed in the mailing list, e.g. when intercepting `cancel` events, too, I think this is quite the pitfall for new users evaluating R2DBC.

#### Describe the solution you'd like

I'd love to see resource management examples on at least:

- https://r2dbc.io
- https://github.com/r2dbc/r2dbc-pool/blob/main/README.md

I'd love to provide a PR, but I don't feel I'll produce the correct solution yet, using reactor or Rx or other APIs. The groups discussion above hinted at using `usingWhen`, perhaps similar to this change here in the oracle driver?
https://github.com/r2dbc/r2dbc-spi/pull/223/commits/e8de1bc5f521bb39dea2a6b17aff246f6e00a6fb

Alternatively, the r2dbc.io homepage example could avoid using a pool, in case of which resource management is out of scope for the example. But I still think that this very important question should be answered very early on when someone looks at R2DBC for the first time.', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/r2dbc/r2dbc.github.io/issues/30/reactions', 'total_count': 1, '+1': 1, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'timeline_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/r2dbc/r2dbc.github.io/issues/30/timeline', 'performed_via_github_app': None}}

Signed-off-by: Mark Paluch <mpaluch@vmware.com>', 'distinct': False, 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/r2dbc/r2dbc-spi/commits/2448d4f322ca80721ea39274c09fdb9e7da410b4'}, {'sha': 'f6e2498f32d1fe6d5b2c3371514bf65fa4a7c003', 'author': {'email': 'diego.dupinmariadb.com', 'name': 'diego Dupin'}, 'message': 'Fix `TestKit` encoding where `ByteBuffer.array` may not exactly represent UTF8 encoded bytes.

backing array ByteBuffer.array may not exactly represent UTF8 encoded bytes.
PR permit to ensure test is valid whatever the JVM is used

Example using jdk8:

"test-value".getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8) => 0x746573742D76616C7565
StandardCharsets.UTF_8.encode("test-value").array() => 0x746573742D76616C756500 having an additional ending 0x00
Signed-off-by: diego Dupin <diego.dupin@gmail.com>

'2022-04-25T09:47:40Z', 'closed_at': '2022-04-25T08:42:49Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': '## Bug Report

<!-- First of all: Have you checked the docs, GitHub issues, or Stack Overflow whether someone else has already reported your issue? -->

I had trouble figuring out whether this should be filed here or https://github.com/r2dbc/r2dbc-spi or https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-relational or somewhere else. Please let me know if I got it wrong and I'll be happy to move it.

I've tried:

* Reading the various docs:
	* https://docs.spring.io/spring-data/r2dbc/docs/current/reference/html
	* https://docs.spring.io/spring-framework/docs/current/reference/html/data-access.html#r2dbc
	* https://github.com/pgjdbc/r2dbc-postgresql/blob/main/README.md
* Searching GitHub and various examples repositories
* Stepping through the code in the debugger

#### Versions

- Driver: postgresql:42.3.3
- Database: Postgres 14.1
- Java: 18
- OS: Arch Linux/Windows 11/macOS

#### Current Behavior

<!-- A clear and concise description of the behavior.-->

For this code:

```java
@Query(
    """
  INSERT INTO app.feed_entries
    (feed_id, title, guid, publication_date, link, description, content, tags)
    VALUES (:entries)
  """)
Mono<Void> insertAll(List<FeedEntry> entry);
```

Intending to be able to insert multiple `FeedEntry`s in one go by having the `(:entries)` expand to `(1, 2, 3), (4, 5, 6)` etc., similar to the SELECT lists support that appears to exist.

I essentially get this:

```
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: value must not be null
```

I stepped through the code and it appears to be due to this line:

https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-relational/blob/9b3aeef6d4bb2b08c036885fe357b6c491499c17/spring-data-relational/src/main/java/org/springframework/data/relational/core/conversion/BasicRelationalConverter.java#L203

Basically since the beans have the `@Id` identifier field set to `null` (since they're new, to-be inserted) and the identifier is an auto-generated UUID, that line results in `id = null`. This then ends up writing an entry with key `null`.

I can't tell if this kind of thing should be possible or not. If not in its current form then how? I wonder if maybe with SpEL expressions or something?

#### Table schema

<!--- Provide the table schema. -->

<details>
<summary>Input Code</summary>

```sql
CREATE TABLE app.feed_entries (
    id uuid DEFAULT public.uuid_generate_v4() NOT NULL,
    date_created timestamp with time zone DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    title text NOT NULL,
    guid text NOT NULL,
    publication_date timestamp with time zone DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    link text,
    description text,
    content text,
    tags text[] DEFAULT '{}'::text[] NOT NULL,
    feed_id uuid NOT NULL
);
```

</details>

#### Steps to reproduce

<!-- Java/Kotlin/Scala/Groovy/‚Ä¶ or Repo link to a Minimal, Reproducible Example if applicable.
Preferably raw R2DBC code without any 3rd-party dependencies. -->

<details>
<summary>Input Code</summary>

```java
@Query(
    """
  INSERT INTO app.feed_entries
    (feed_id, title, guid, publication_date, link, description, content, tags)
    VALUES (:entries)
  """)
Mono<Void> insertAll(List<FeedEntry> entry);
```

</details>

#### Expected behavior/code

<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen (or code). -->

I expected to be able to insert multiple `FeedEntry`s.

#### Possible Solution

<!-- Only if you have suggestions on a fix for the bug -->

Is this supposed to be possible?

I tried passing `List<Object[]>` like it says in the documentation [here](https://docs.spring.io/spring-framework/docs/current/reference/html/data-access.html#r2dbc-DatabaseClient-named-parameters) although that is for SELECT lists.

'2022-04-25T08:54:29Z', 'closed_at': '2022-04-25T08:42:49Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': '## Bug Report

<!-- First of all: Have you checked the docs, GitHub issues, or Stack Overflow whether someone else has already reported your issue? -->

I had trouble figuring out whether this should be filed here or https://github.com/r2dbc/r2dbc-spi or https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-relational or somewhere else. Please let me know if I got it wrong and I'll be happy to move it.

I've tried:

* Reading the various docs:
	* https://docs.spring.io/spring-data/r2dbc/docs/current/reference/html
	* https://docs.spring.io/spring-framework/docs/current/reference/html/data-access.html#r2dbc
	* https://github.com/pgjdbc/r2dbc-postgresql/blob/main/README.md
* Searching GitHub and various examples repositories
* Stepping through the code in the debugger

#### Versions

- Driver: postgresql:42.3.3
- Database: Postgres 14.1
- Java: 18
- OS: Arch Linux/Windows 11/macOS

#### Current Behavior

<!-- A clear and concise description of the behavior.-->

For this code:

```java
@Query(
    """
  INSERT INTO app.feed_entries
    (feed_id, title, guid, publication_date, link, description, content, tags)
    VALUES (:entries)
  """)
Mono<Void> insertAll(List<FeedEntry> entry);
```

Intending to be able to insert multiple `FeedEntry`s in one go by having the `(:entries)` expand to `(1, 2, 3), (4, 5, 6)` etc., similar to the SELECT lists support that appears to exist.

I essentially get this:

```
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: value must not be null
```

I stepped through the code and it appears to be due to this line:

https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-relational/blob/9b3aeef6d4bb2b08c036885fe357b6c491499c17/spring-data-relational/src/main/java/org/springframework/data/relational/core/conversion/BasicRelationalConverter.java#L203

Basically since the beans have the `@Id` identifier field set to `null` (since they're new, to-be inserted) and the identifier is an auto-generated UUID, that line results in `id = null`. This then ends up writing an entry with key `null`.

I can't tell if this kind of thing should be possible or not. If not in its current form then how? I wonder if maybe with SpEL expressions or something?

<details>
<summary>Stack trace</summary>

```

#### Table schema

<!--- Provide the table schema. -->

<details>
<summary>Input Code</summary>

```sql
CREATE TABLE app.feed_entries (
    id uuid DEFAULT public.uuid_generate_v4() NOT NULL,
    date_created timestamp with time zone DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    title text NOT NULL,
    guid text NOT NULL,
    publication_date timestamp with time zone DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    link text,
    description text,
    content text,
    tags text[] DEFAULT '{}'::text[] NOT NULL,
    feed_id uuid NOT NULL
);
```

</details>

#### Steps to reproduce

<!-- Java/Kotlin/Scala/Groovy/‚Ä¶ or Repo link to a Minimal, Reproducible Example if applicable.
Preferably raw R2DBC code without any 3rd-party dependencies. -->

<details>
<summary>Input Code</summary>

```java
@Query(
    """
  INSERT INTO app.feed_entries
    (feed_id, title, guid, publication_date, link, description, content, tags)
    VALUES (:entries)
  """)
Mono<Void> insertAll(List<FeedEntry> entry);
```

</details>

#### Expected behavior/code

<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen (or code). -->

I expected to be able to insert multiple `FeedEntry`s.

#### Possible Solution

<!-- Only if you have suggestions on a fix for the bug -->

Is this supposed to be possible?

I tried passing `List<Object[]>` like it says in the documentation [here](https://docs.spring.io/spring-framework/docs/current/reference/html/data-access.html#r2dbc-DatabaseClient-named-parameters) although that is for SELECT lists.

'closed_at': '2022-04-25T08:42:49Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': '## Bug Report

<!-- First of all: Have you checked the docs, GitHub issues, or Stack Overflow whether someone else has already reported your issue? -->

I had trouble figuring out whether this should be filed here or https://github.com/r2dbc/r2dbc-spi or https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-relational or somewhere else. Please let me know if I got it wrong and I'll be happy to move it.

I've tried:

* Reading the various docs:
	* https://docs.spring.io/spring-data/r2dbc/docs/current/reference/html
	* https://docs.spring.io/spring-framework/docs/current/reference/html/data-access.html#r2dbc
	* https://github.com/pgjdbc/r2dbc-postgresql/blob/main/README.md
* Searching GitHub and various examples repositories
* Stepping through the code in the debugger

#### Versions

- Driver: postgresql:42.3.3
- Database: Postgres 14.1
- Java: 18
- OS: Arch Linux/Windows 11/macOS

#### Current Behavior

<!-- A clear and concise description of the behavior.-->

For this code:

```java
@Query(
    """
  INSERT INTO app.feed_entries
    (feed_id, title, guid, publication_date, link, description, content, tags)
    VALUES (:entries)
  """)
Mono<Void> insertAll(List<FeedEntry> entry);
```

Intending to be able to insert multiple `FeedEntry`s in one go by having the `(:entries)` expand to `(1, 2, 3), (4, 5, 6)` etc., similar to the SELECT lists support that appears to exist.

I essentially get this:

```
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: value must not be null
```

I stepped through the code and it appears to be due to this line:

https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-relational/blob/9b3aeef6d4bb2b08c036885fe357b6c491499c17/spring-data-relational/src/main/java/org/springframework/data/relational/core/conversion/BasicRelationalConverter.java#L203

Basically since the beans have the `@Id` identifier field set to `null` (since they're new, to-be inserted) and the identifier is an auto-generated UUID, that line results in `id = null`. This then ends up writing an entry with key `null`.

I can't tell if this kind of thing should be possible or not. If not in its current form then how? I wonder if maybe with SpEL expressions or something?

CREATE TABLE app.feed_entries (
    id uuid DEFAULT public.uuid_generate_v4() NOT NULL,
    date_created timestamp with time zone DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    title text NOT NULL,
    guid text NOT NULL,
    publication_date timestamp with time zone DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    link text,
    description text,
    content text,
    tags text[] DEFAULT '{}'::text[] NOT NULL,
    feed_id uuid NOT NULL
);
```

```java
@Query(
    """
  INSERT INTO app.feed_entries
    (feed_id, title, guid, publication_date, link, description, content, tags)
    VALUES (:entries)
  """)
Mono<Void> insertAll(List<FeedEntry> entry);
```

#### Expected behavior/code

<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen (or code). -->

I expected to be able to insert multiple `FeedEntry`s.

#### Possible Solution

<!-- Only if you have suggestions on a fix for the bug -->

Is this supposed to be possible?

I tried passing `List<Object[]>` like it says in the documentation [here](https://docs.spring.io/spring-framework/docs/current/reference/html/data-access.html#r2dbc-DatabaseClient-named-parameters) although that is for SELECT lists.

<!-- First of all: Have you checked the docs, GitHub issues, or Stack Overflow whether someone else has already reported your issue? -->

I had trouble figuring out whether this should be filed here or https://github.com/r2dbc/r2dbc-spi or https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-relational or somewhere else. Please let me know if I got it wrong and I'll be happy to move it.

I've tried:

* Reading the various docs:
	* https://docs.spring.io/spring-data/r2dbc/docs/current/reference/html
	* https://docs.spring.io/spring-framework/docs/current/reference/html/data-access.html#r2dbc
	* https://github.com/pgjdbc/r2dbc-postgresql/blob/main/README.md
* Searching GitHub and various examples repositories
* Stepping through the code in the debugger

#### Versions

- Driver: postgresql:42.3.3
- Database: Postgres 14.1
- Java: 18
- OS: Arch Linux/Windows 11/macOS

#### Current Behavior

<!-- A clear and concise description of the behavior.-->

For this code:

```java
@Query(
    """
  INSERT INTO app.feed_entries
    (feed_id, title, guid, publication_date, link, description, content, tags)
    VALUES (:entries)
  """)
Mono<Void> insertAll(List<FeedEntry> entry);
```

Intending to be able to insert multiple `FeedEntry`s in one go by having the `(:entries)` expand to `(1, 2, 3), (4, 5, 6)` etc., similar to the SELECT lists support that appears to exist.

I essentially get this:

```
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: value must not be null
```

I stepped through the code and it appears to be due to this line:

https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-relational/blob/9b3aeef6d4bb2b08c036885fe357b6c491499c17/spring-data-relational/src/main/java/org/springframework/data/relational/core/conversion/BasicRelationalConverter.java#L203

Basically since the beans have the `@Id` identifier field set to `null` (since they're new, to-be inserted) and the identifier is an auto-generated UUID, that line results in `id = null`. This then ends up writing an entry with key `null`.

I can't tell if this kind of thing should be possible or not. If not in its current form then how? I wonder if maybe with SpEL expressions or something?

#### Table schema

<!--- Provide the table schema. -->

<details>
<summary>Input Code</summary>

```sql
CREATE TABLE app.feed_entries (
    id uuid DEFAULT public.uuid_generate_v4() NOT NULL,
    date_created timestamp with time zone DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    title text NOT NULL,
    guid text NOT NULL,
    publication_date timestamp with time zone DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    link text,
    description text,
    content text,
    tags text[] DEFAULT '{}'::text[] NOT NULL,
    feed_id uuid NOT NULL
);
```

</details>

#### Steps to reproduce

<!-- Java/Kotlin/Scala/Groovy/‚Ä¶ or Repo link to a Minimal, Reproducible Example if applicable.
Preferably raw R2DBC code without any 3rd-party dependencies. -->

<details>
<summary>Input Code</summary>

```java
@Query(
    """
  INSERT INTO app.feed_entries
    (feed_id, title, guid, publication_date, link, description, content, tags)
    VALUES (:entries)
  """)
Mono<Void> insertAll(List<FeedEntry> entry);
```

</details>

#### Expected behavior/code

<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen (or code). -->

I expected to be able to insert multiple `FeedEntry`s.

#### Possible Solution

<!-- Only if you have suggestions on a fix for the bug -->

Is this supposed to be possible?

I tried passing `List<Object[]>` like it says in the documentation [here](https://docs.spring.io/spring-framework/docs/current/reference/html/data-access.html#r2dbc-DatabaseClient-named-parameters) although that is for SELECT lists.

'author_association': 'MEMBER', 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': "Going forward, we're looking for a composition library that remains stable and doesn't produce conflicts with upgrades. Project Reactor plans a 4.0 release and that release is likely to require adoption for the public API. We want to use a composition library that supports Reactive Streams as first-class citizen and where co-existence of newer major versions is possible. RxJava has proved the coexistence of multiple versions with versions 2 and 3 by using versioned packages.", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/r2dbc/r2dbc-spi/issues/245/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'timeline_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/r2dbc/r2dbc-spi/issues/245/timeline', 'performed_via_github_app': None}, 'comment': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/r2dbc/r2dbc-spi/issues/comments/1108259602', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/r2dbc/r2dbc-spi/issues/245#issuecomment-1108259602', 'issue_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/r2dbc/r2dbc-spi/issues/245', 'id': 1108259602, 'node_id': 'IC_kwDOCCnWws5CDrMS', 'user': {'login': 'mp911de', 'id': 1035015, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjEwMzUwMTU=', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/1035015?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/mp911de', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2022-04-25T08:40:26Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-25T08:40:26Z', 'author_association': 'MEMBER', 'body': 'Not moving to RxJava 3 as the base infrastructure (e.g. `usingWhen` operator) is not easily usable for resource management and requires additional operator logic in our test kit. 'closed_at': '2022-04-19T12:52:16Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': 'To migrate some production MongoDBs I opted for using replica sets to minimize downtime. While everything is working when running in standalone mode, things fall apart when switching to a RS with the following config
```yaml
version: "2.2"
services:
  mongo:
    image: mongo
    volumes:
      - mongo-data:/data/db
      - ./rs-init.sh:/scripts/rs-init.sh:ro
    networks:
      - appNetwork
    ports:
      - ${MONGO_PORT}:27017
    mem_limit: 1500m
    command: --wiredTigerEngineConfigString="cache_size=512M"
    entrypoint: [ "/usr/bin/mongod", "--bind_ip_all", "--replSet", "test" ]
    restart: always
```
The `rs-init.sh` script contains the following:

```bash
#!/bin/bash

mongo <<EOF
var config = {
    "_id": "test",
    "version": 1,
    "members": [
        {
            "_id": 1,
            "host": "PRIMARY_NODE_IP:PORT",
            "priority": 2
        },
        {
            "_id": 2,
            "host": "HIDDEN_NODE_IP:PORT",
            "priority": 0,
            "hidden": true
        }
    ]
};
rs.initiate(config, { force: true });
EOF
```

I got it to start syncing. The primary node was in status PRIMARY and the secondary (hidden) node was in STARTUP2. During the initial sync the spring application failed to start with the error:

```

'2022-04-21T09:33:38Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-21T09:33:38Z', 'author_association': 'MEMBER', 'body': "I'm a bit reluctant to backport these changes, especially towards a version that is GA since over a year. Changes to `RedisMessageListenerContainer` have shown that they are likely to cause all sorts of synchronization problems due to their highly concurrent nature.

The actual problem with Jedis and `RedisMessageListenerContainer` is that the startup/lazy listening lets the other processes proceed although we do not have a confirmation response from Redis. That can lead to concurrent usage of the `OutputStream`.

I strongly argue to leave the revised implementation on the `2.7.x` branch, especially since the GA release is scheduled for May 13. I would also strongly recommend upgrading to the 2.7 RC1 release to verify that the revised implementation solves more problems than it creates.", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-redis/issues/comments/1104954834/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}}

'closed_at': '2022-04-19T12:52:16Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': 'To migrate some production MongoDBs I opted for using replica sets to minimize downtime. While everything is working when running in standalone mode, things fall apart when switching to a RS with the following config
```yaml
version: "2.2"
services:
  mongo:
    image: mongo
    volumes:
      - mongo-data:/data/db
      - ./rs-init.sh:/scripts/rs-init.sh:ro
    networks:
      - appNetwork
    ports:
      - ${MONGO_PORT}:27017
    mem_limit: 1500m
    command: --wiredTigerEngineConfigString="cache_size=512M"
    entrypoint: [ "/usr/bin/mongod", "--bind_ip_all", "--replSet", "test" ]
    restart: always
```
The `rs-init.sh` script contains the following:

```bash
#!/bin/bash

mongo <<EOF
var config = {
    "_id": "test",
    "version": 1,
    "members": [
        {
            "_id": 1,
            "host": "PRIMARY_NODE_IP:PORT",
            "priority": 2
        },
        {
            "_id": 2,
            "host": "HIDDEN_NODE_IP:PORT",
            "priority": 0,
            "hidden": true
        }
    ]
};
rs.initiate(config, { force: true });
EOF
```

I got it to start syncing. The primary node was in status PRIMARY and the secondary (hidden) node was in STARTUP2. During the initial sync the spring application failed to start with the error:

```
org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanCreationException: Error creating bean with name 'repositoryMigration' defined in file 
[/app/classes/powerbot/server/m7/repositories/RepositoryMigration.class]: Invocation of init method failed; nested exception is 
org.springframework.data.mongodb.UncategorizedMongoDbException:  Command failed with error 10107 (NotWritablePrimary): 'not 
master' on server mongo:27017. The full response is

But the primary node indeed was in state PRIMARY and `db.isMaster()` returned true as well. I noticed three reoccurring log messages that are sent every 10s:

```
Apr 14, 2022 @ 18:17:39.279 DEBUG Checking status of mongo:27017
Apr 14, 2022 @ 18:17:39.279 DEBUG Updating cluster description to  {type=REPLICA_SET, servers=[{address=mongo:27017, type=REPLICA_SET_PRIMARY, roundTripTime=4.2 ms, state=CONNECTED}]
Apr 14, 2022 @ 18:17:49.082 DEBUG Sending command '{"ismaster": 1, "$db": "admin", "$clusterTime": {"clusterTime": {"$timestamp": {"t": 1649953054, "i": 1}}, "signature": {"hash": {"$binary": {"base64": "AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA=", "subType": "00"}}, "keyId": 0}}}' with request id 112 to database admin on connection [connectionId{localValue:1, serverValue:17}] to server mongo:27017
```

But right before spring throws the above exception, there are these odd logs:

```
Apr 14, 2022 @ 18:18:04.180 DEBUG Updating cluster description to  {type=REPLICA_SET, servers=[{address=mongo:27017, type=REPLICA_SET_SECONDARY, roundTripTime=4.0 ms, state=CONNECTED}]
Apr 14, 2022 @ 18:17:54.193 DEBUG Updating cluster description to  {type=UNKNOWN, servers=[{address=mongo:27017, type=UNKNOWN, state=CONNECTING}]

```
Why is spring updating the cluster description? My code is below. (kotlin)
```kotlin
val documents = mutableListOf<Member>()
File(fileName).forEachLine { line -> documents.add(Member(line)) }

val bulkOps = mongoTemplate.bulkOps(BulkOperations.BulkMode.ORDERED, "member")

documents.chunked(50).parallelStream().forEach { chunk ->
    bulkOps.insert(chunk)
    bulkOps.execute()
}
```

'2022-04-11T22:56:02Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-20T14:50:40Z', 'closed_at': None, 'author_association': 'NONE', 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': 'We ran into the situation that was referenced in [DATAREDIS-1052](https://jira.spring.io/browse/DATAREDIS-1052?redirect=false)

We had an exception during the attempt to unlock:
ExceptionCause="redis.clients.jedis.exceptions.JedisConnectionException: Attempting to read from a broken connection" ExceptionStack="org.springframework.data.redis.RedisConnectionFailureException: Attempting to read from a broken connection; nested exception is redis.clients.jedis.exceptions.JedisConnectionException: Attempting to read from a broken connection
	at org.springframework.data.redis.connection.jedis.JedisExceptionConverter.convert(JedisExceptionConverter.java:65)
	at org.springframework.data.redis.connection.jedis.JedisExceptionConverter.convert(JedisExceptionConverter.java:42)
	at org.springframework.data.redis.PassThroughExceptionTranslationStrategy.translate(PassThroughExceptionTranslationStrategy.java:44)
	at org.springframework.data.redis.FallbackExceptionTranslationStrategy.translate(FallbackExceptionTranslationStrategy.java:42)
	at org.springframework.data.redis.connection.jedis.JedisConnection.convertJedisAccessException(JedisConnection.java:135)
	at org.springframework.data.redis.connection.jedis.JedisKeyCommands.del(JedisKeyCommands.java:122)
	at org.springframework.data.redis.connection.DefaultedRedisConnection.del(DefaultedRedisConnection.java:82)
	at org.springframework.data.redis.cache.DefaultRedisCacheWriter.doUnlock(DefaultRedisCacheWriter.java:228)


After this , all threads trying to access the key were stuck waiting:

java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (sleeping)
	at java.lang.Thread.sleep(Native Method)
	at org.springframework.data.redis.cache.DefaultRedisCacheWriter.checkAndPotentiallyWaitUntilUnlocked(DefaultRedisCacheWriter.java:274)
	at org.springframework.data.redis.cache.DefaultRedisCacheWriter.execute(DefaultRedisCacheWriter.java:247)
	at org.springframework.data.redis.cache.DefaultRedisCacheWriter.get(DefaultRedisCacheWriter.java:110)
	at org.springframework.data.redis.cache.RedisCache.lookup(RedisCache.java:88)
	

And there was no client to release this lock.

We were wondering if it would be possible to add the ability to send the expiration time in the SET NX command when this lock is created, so that system could automatically recover from this situation.

Thanks
Art
', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-redis/issues/2300/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'timeline_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-redis/issues/2300/timeline', 'performed_via_github_app': None}, 'comment': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-redis/issues/comments/1104025178', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-redis/issues/2300#issuecomment-1104025178', 'issue_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-redis/issues/2300', 'id': 1104025178, 'node_id': 'IC_kwDOAB5CdM5BzhZa', 'user': {'login': 'mp911de', 'id': 1035015, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjEwMzUwMTU=', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/1035015?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/mp911de', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2022-04-20T14:50:40Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-20T14:50:40Z', 'author_association': 'MEMBER', 'body': 'The issue is caused by the lock entry not being cleaned up. In this case, the cleanup failed because the connection became unusable. There are a couple of ways out here:

1. Setting a TTL
2. Retrying the cleanup

While we could retry the cleanup in case the connection is disconnected, the cleanup could still fail in case the Redis server went down.

I think that we should extend our `RedisCacheWriter` creation to allow specifying a lock TTL. We have already a few configuration properties such as `BatchStrategy` and `SleepTimeout` that we could pull together into another configuration object and add the lock TTL as a third configuration option so different caches can use different lock timeouts.', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-redis/issues/comments/1104025178/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}}

{'push_id': 9672751152, 'size': 1, 'distinct_size': 1, 'ref': 'refs/heads/main', 'head': '5f75eab65eb19b16d46b6e60c374f5e7696567db', 'before': 'e0f49370d92a10c82fa9134919aa77c96295ff90', 'commits': [{'sha': '5f75eab65eb19b16d46b6e60c374f5e7696567db', 'author': {'email': 'mpaluch@vmware.com', 'name': 'Mark Paluch'}, 'message': 'Attempt early usage of custom converters.

We now try to eagerly apply a custom converter when reading Redis properties in the MappingRedisConverter before considering type hints from the hash.

We require type hints to properly restore the target type for a hash entry as Redis data is all byte arrays, so a simple String needs a type hint before we can load it back into an e.g. Object-typed property. Subtypes of properties (such as ZoneRegion for ZoneId) are sometimes not associated with a converter as only the parent type (ZoneId) is associated with a converter. Trying to convert the value into the subtype directly through our ConversionService would fail in that case.

Closes #2307', 'distinct': True, 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-redis/commits/5f75eab65eb19b16d46b6e60c374f5e7696567db'}]}

'2022-04-20T13:27:13Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': 'I have an entity with ZoneId property.
When I made parsing String value within ZoneId.of() method I've got ZoneRegion implementation class.
E.g Zone.of("Europe/Paris) -> ZoneRegion("Europe/Paris)
During the Writing entity everything goes fine and have next info in hashes:
3)"timezone"
4) "Europe/Paris"
5) "timezone._class"
6) "java.time.ZoneRegion"
Accordingly, when I try to read value - follow exception occurs:
ConverterNotFoundException: No converter found capable of converting from type [byte[]] to type [java.time.ZoneRegion]

'2022-04-20T13:00:47Z', 'closed_at': None, 'author_association': 'NONE', 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': 'I have an entity with ZoneId property.
When I made parsing String value within ZoneId.of() method I've got ZoneRegion implementation class.
E.g Zone.of("Europe/Paris) -> ZoneRegion("Europe/Paris)
During the Writing entity everything goes fine and have next info in hashes:
3)"timezone"
4) "Europe/Paris"
5) "timezone._class"
6) "java.time.ZoneRegion"
Accordingly, when I try to read value - follow exception occurs:
ConverterNotFoundException: No converter found capable of converting from type [byte[]] to type [java.time.ZoneRegion]
 ', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-redis/issues/2307/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'timeline_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-redis/issues/2307/timeline', 'performed_via_github_app': None}, 'comment': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-redis/issues/comments/1103905005', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-redis/issues/2307#issuecomment-1103905005', 'issue_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-redis/issues/2307', 'id': 1103905005, 'node_id': 'IC_kwDOAB5CdM5BzEDt', 'user': {'login': 'mp911de', 'id': 1035015, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjEwMzUwMTU=', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/1035015?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/mp911de', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2022-04-20T13:00:47Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-20T13:00:47Z', 'author_association': 'MEMBER', 'body': 'Thanks for reporting the issue. The problem is on our side because we write a more concrete type hint (`ZoneRegion` instead of `ZoneId`) while we have only a converter for `ZoneId` registered. We can likely skip type hints for types that are associated with a converter anyway as the persistent property provides sufficient details here.', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-redis/issues/comments/1103905005/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}}

{'action': 'created', 'issue': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-solr/issues/806', 'repository_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-solr', 'labels_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-solr/issues/806/labels{/name}', 'comments_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-solr/issues/806/comments', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-solr/issues/806/events', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-solr/issues/806', 'id': 1200551828, 'node_id': 'I_kwDOAFe3nM5HjveU', 'number': 806, 'title': 'Upgrading to Spring Boot 2.5 and running into Spring Data Solr deprecation. What are the alternatives? ', 'user': {'login': 'saramorsi', 'id': 72559608, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjcyNTU5NjA4', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/72559608?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/saramorsi', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/saramorsi', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/saramorsi/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/saramorsi/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/saramorsi/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/saramorsi/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/saramorsi/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/saramorsi/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/saramorsi/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/saramorsi/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/saramorsi/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'site_admin': False}, 'labels': [{'id': 2509576822, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyNTA5NTc2ODIy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-solr/labels/status:%20waiting-for-triage', 'name': 'status: waiting-for-triage', 'color': 'fef2c0', 'default': False, 'description': "An issue we've not yet triaged"}], 'state': 'open', 'locked': False, 'assignee': None, 'assignees': [], 'milestone': None, 'comments': 1, 'created_at': '2022-04-11T21:20:36Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-20T07:59:59Z', 'closed_at': None, 'author_association': 'NONE', 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': 'We are using Spring Data Solr and are on Spring Boot 2.4.8 right now. Once we upgrade to Spring Boot 2.5.12 (to patch a major Spring Core vulnerability), we are running into this issue where the [auto configuration is removed] in Spring 2.5+ (https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-2.5-Release-Notes#spring-data-solr) which means we will have to handle some methods, annotations and properties on our own. E.g. annotations and classes like @SolrDocument, @Query, FacetPage, SolrCrudRepository, etc.. we can‚Äôt use anymore.

I‚Äôm finding little resources online on advice around migrating over and what to use in place of these annotations, classes and code. Any advice on what equivalents we should be using instead in Spring or should we just rewrite our code to use SolrJ? 

Thank you. ', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-solr/issues/806/reactions', 'total_count': 1, '+1': 1, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'timeline_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-solr/issues/806/timeline', 'performed_via_github_app': None}, 'comment': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-solr/issues/comments/1103588228', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-solr/issues/806#issuecomment-1103588228', 'issue_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-solr/issues/806', 'id': 1103588228, 'node_id': 'IC_kwDOAFe3nM5Bx2uE', 'user': {'login': 'mp911de', 'id': 1035015, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjEwMzUwMTU=', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/1035015?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/mp911de', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2022-04-20T07:59:59Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-20T07:59:59Z', 'author_association': 'MEMBER', 'body': 'Spring Data Solr was discontinued after the release of `4.3.x` and is no longer maintained nor released. We suggest migrating over to Spring Data Elasticsearch. Since the Elasticsearch module is maintained by the community, you could ask [there](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-elasticsearch/issues) whether the project would be able to provide a migration guide on how to switch from Solr to Elasticsearch. However, switching to Elasticsearch requires also migration to a different data store, requiring more than just code changes.

The alternative is that someone forks this repository and catches up with maintenance. All code is Apache-licensed allowing to fork and re-release the code under a different gropupId. From a community perspective, having an actively maintained fork would be the best option. Our team does not have the bandwidth to provide the necessary level of maintenance and feature development for the Spring Data Solr module. ', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-solr/issues/comments/1103588228/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}}

'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': '**Describe the bug**
According to the Spring Cloud Vault documentation, I can use the field spring.cloud.vault.enabled to disable connecting to vault in profiles where we don't need the connection.

https://docs.spring.io/spring-cloud-vault/docs/current/reference/html/#vault.configdata.location.optional

However, if I run under a profile where spring.cloud.vault.enabled=true, the application crashes because some of the inactive profiles have spring.cloud.vault.enabled=false.


`Reason: org.springframework.boot.context.config.InactiveConfigDataAccessException: Inactive property source 'Config resource 'class path resource [application.yml]' via location 'optional:classpath:/' (document #2)' imported from location 'class path resource [application.yml]' cannot contain property 'spring.cloud.vault.enabled' [origin: class path resource [application.yml] - 67:16]`

**Sample**
application.yml:
```yml
spring:
  application:
    name: ApplicationName-v2
  config:
    import: 
      - "optional:vault://"
  cloud:
    vault:
      enabled: true
      host: vault.mycompany.org
      port: 8200
      scheme: https
      authentication: TOKEN
      kv:
        enabled: true
        default-context: ApplicationName
        backend: ApplicationName-test
        profile-separator: '/'
        
---
spring:
  config.activate.on-profile: local
  cloud:
    vault:
      enabled: true

---
spring:
  config.activate.on-profile: default
  cloud:
    vault:
      enabled: false

---
spring:
  config.activate.on-profile: prod
  cloud:
    vault:
      kv:
        backend: ApplicationName-prod
```', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-cloud/spring-cloud-vault/issues/640/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'timeline_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-cloud/spring-cloud-vault/issues/640/timeline', 'performed_via_github_app': None}}

'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': '**Describe the bug**
According to the Spring Cloud Vault documentation, I can use the field spring.cloud.vault.enabled to disable connecting to vault in profiles where we don't need the connection.

https://docs.spring.io/spring-cloud-vault/docs/current/reference/html/#vault.configdata.location.optional

However, if I run under a profile where spring.cloud.vault.enabled=true, the application crashes because some of the inactive profiles have spring.cloud.vault.enabled=false.


`Reason: org.springframework.boot.context.config.InactiveConfigDataAccessException: Inactive property source 'Config resource 'class path resource [application.yml]' via location 'optional:classpath:/' (document #2)' imported from location 'class path resource [application.yml]' cannot contain property 'spring.cloud.vault.enabled' [origin: class path resource [application.yml] - 67:16]`

**Sample**
application.yml:
```yml
spring:
  application:
    name: ApplicationName-v2
  config:
    import: 
      - "optional:vault://"
  cloud:
    vault:
      enabled: true
      host: vault.mycompany.org
      port: 8200
      scheme: https
      authentication: TOKEN
      kv:
        enabled: true
        default-context: ApplicationName
        backend: ApplicationName-test
        profile-separator: '/'
        
---
spring:
  config.activate.on-profile: local
  cloud:
    vault:
      enabled: true

---
spring:
  config.activate.on-profile: default
  cloud:
    vault:
      enabled: false

---
spring:
  config.activate.on-profile: prod
  cloud:
    vault:
      kv:
        backend: ApplicationName-prod
```', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-cloud/spring-cloud-vault/issues/640/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, '2022-04-19T13:10:01Z', 'closed_at': None, 'author_association': 'NONE', 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': 'Upgrading from spring boot 2.2.8 to 2.5.5. , we saw an increase in the number of connections ie, double what is configured in pool.local.size. 
We could not reproduce this issue only using the Cassandra driver upgrade and reproduced it with the Sping boot upgrade. We believe the increase in the number of connections is coming from the following code related to spring boot, which was added as a part upgrade from spring boot 2.2.8 to 2.5.5. We believe this code piece is added to initialize keyspace and believe it spawns an additional connection, which is mostly idle after the initial connection and is only kept open to destroy script on shutdown etc...

https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-cassandra/blob/3.2.5/spring-data-cassandra/src/main/java/org/springframework/data/cassandra/config/CqlSessionFactoryBean.java#L447-L462

Can you please let us know why after the upgrade double the number of connections is needed and what if there is any possible impact of it?

With the rewrite of driver internals, we had to rewrite our schema support and due to driver restrictions, we had to switch to a different allocation scheme for resources. Spring Boot uses specifically [`SessionFactoryFactoryBean`](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-cassandra/blob/f2ae546c23930507b2d6d85f024e0f444c561416/spring-data-cassandra/src/main/java/org/springframework/data/cassandra/config/SessionFactoryFactoryBean.java#L124-L137) to perform the keyspace initialization.', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-cassandra/issues/comments/1102632828/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}}

'2022-04-19T13:03:36Z', 'closed_at': None, 'author_association': 'NONE', 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': 'Version: 1.4.3 (Spring Boot 2.6.6.)
DB: PostgreSQL

Schema:


```
CREATE TABLE tag
(
    id uuid NOT NULL,
    name character varying(32) NOT NULL,
    is_deleted boolean NOT NULL DEFAULT false,
    version integer NOT NULL,
    created_date timestamp with time zone NOT NULL,
    modified_date timestamp with time zone NOT NULL,
    created_by character varying(256) NOT NULL,
    modified_by character varying(256) NOT NULL,
    CONSTRAINT tag_pkey PRIMARY KEY (id)
)
```

Tag Entity

```
data class Tag(
    @Id val id: UUID = UUID.randomUUID(),
    val name: String,
    val isDeleted: Boolean = false,
    @Version val version: Long = 0,
    @CreatedDate val createdDate: OffsetDateTime = OffsetDateTime.now(),
    @LastModifiedDate val modifiedDate: OffsetDateTime = OffsetDateTime.now(),
    @CreatedBy val createdBy: String = ANONYMOUS,
    @LastModifiedBy val modifiedBy: String = ANONYMOUS,
)
```

When calling

```
r2dbcEntityTemplate.select(query, entityClass)
```
where 
```
query.criteria = "isDeleted IS FALSE"
```

got 

```
org.springframework.r2dbc.BadSqlGrammarException: executeMany; bad SQL grammar [SELECT tag.* FROM tag WHERE tag.is_deleted = UPPER($1) LIMIT 2147483647]; nested exception is io.r2dbc.postgresql.ExceptionFactory$PostgresqlBadGrammarException: [42883] function upper(boolean) does not exist

'closed_at': '2022-04-19T12:52:16Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': 'To migrate some production MongoDBs I opted for using replica sets to minimize downtime. While everything is working when running in standalone mode, things fall apart when switching to a RS with the following config
```yaml
version: "2.2"
services:
  mongo:
    image: mongo
    volumes:
      - mongo-data:/data/db
      - ./rs-init.sh:/scripts/rs-init.sh:ro
    networks:
      - appNetwork
    ports:
      - ${MONGO_PORT}:27017
    mem_limit: 1500m
    command: --wiredTigerEngineConfigString="cache_size=512M"
    entrypoint: [ "/usr/bin/mongod", "--bind_ip_all", "--replSet", "test" ]
    restart: always
```
The `rs-init.sh` script contains the following:

```bash
#!/bin/bash

mongo <<EOF
var config = {
    "_id": "test",
    "version": 1,
    "members": [
        {
            "_id": 1,
            "host": "PRIMARY_NODE_IP:PORT",
            "priority": 2
        },
        {
            "_id": 2,
            "host": "HIDDEN_NODE_IP:PORT",
            "priority": 0,
            "hidden": true
        }
    ]
};
rs.initiate(config, { force: true });
EOF
```

I got it to start syncing. The primary node was in status PRIMARY and the secondary (hidden) node was in STARTUP2. During the initial sync the spring application failed to start with the error:

```
org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanCreationException: Error creating bean with name 'repositoryMigration' defined in file 
[/app/classes/powerbot/server/m7/repositories/RepositoryMigration.class]: Invocation of init method failed; nested exception is 
org.springframework.data.mongodb.UncategorizedMongoDbException:  Command failed with error 10107 (NotWritablePrimary): 'not 
master' on server mongo:27017. The full response is 
```
```json
{
    "topologyVersion": {
        "processId": {
            "$oid": "6258476152adc96e0282f334"
        },
        "counter": 7

'closed_at': '2022-04-19T12:52:16Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': 'To migrate some production MongoDBs I opted for using replica sets to minimize downtime. While everything is working when running in standalone mode, things fall apart when switching to a RS with the following config
```yaml
version: "2.2"
services:
  mongo:
    image: mongo
    volumes:
      - mongo-data:/data/db
      - ./rs-init.sh:/scripts/rs-init.sh:ro
    networks:
      - appNetwork
    ports:
      - ${MONGO_PORT}:27017
    mem_limit: 1500m
    command: --wiredTigerEngineConfigString="cache_size=512M"
    entrypoint: [ "/usr/bin/mongod", "--bind_ip_all", "--replSet", "test" ]
    restart: always
```
The `rs-init.sh` script contains the following:

```bash
#!/bin/bash

mongo <<EOF
var config = {
    "_id": "test",
    "version": 1,
    "members": [
        {
            "_id": 1,
            "host": "PRIMARY_NODE_IP:PORT",
            "priority": 2
        },
        {
            "_id": 2,
            "host": "HIDDEN_NODE_IP:PORT",
            "priority": 0,
            "hidden": true
        }
    ]
};
rs.initiate(config, { force: true });
EOF
```

I got it to start syncing. The primary node was in status PRIMARY and the secondary (hidden) node was in STARTUP2. During the initial sync the spring application failed to start with the error:

```

'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2022-04-19T12:52:16Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-19T12:52:16Z', 'author_association': 'MEMBER', 'body': "The issue is being caused by the fact that Spring Data MongoDB is creating indexes on startup and therefore it requires a fully initialized replica set at startup time. `rs.initiate` is effectively asynchronous. Starting the application while replica set initialization hasn't finished (that is when not all nodes have reached their replica role state) hits the MongoDB cluster in a state where replication setup activity is in progress and therefore failures like the one reported may happen.

You have two options:

1. Delay the application start until the replica set setup is complete.
2. Disable auto-index creation.", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-data-mongodb/issues/comments/1102613796/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}}

This change allows the client to support automatic recurring reauthentication. This, in combination with the credentials provider allows the user to setup a server with ephemeral passwords, that requires periodic re-authentication with new credentials, in order to maintain a secure connection. An example of such an authentication scheme is AWS' [IAM](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/introduction.html)

A scheduler was added to the clients (Redis/Cluster) that runs reauth on configurable time.
The scheduler runs a callback in the clients to go over all the existing connections and send AUTH query on it.

In simple client, it runs AUTH over the connections, taking the credentials from the connection's connectionState.
It takes the credentials from each of the connection in order to support MasterReplica client as well.

In cluster client, it runs AUTH command on the existing connections in the connection provider and also on the default connection of the client. It takes the credentials from the client's FirstUri to AUTH all the existing connections.

This feature is disabled by default.
The default period between reauthentication attempts is 60 minutes.

'2022-04-19T06:51:38Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'active_lock_reason': None, 'draft': False, 'pull_request': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/lettuce-io/lettuce-core/pulls/2070', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/lettuce-io/lettuce-core/pull/2070', 'diff_url': 'https://github.com/lettuce-io/lettuce-core/pull/2070.diff', 'patch_url': 'https://github.com/lettuce-io/lettuce-core/pull/2070.patch', 'merged_at': None}, 'body': "Support for re-authentication.

This change allows the client to support automatic recurring reauthentication. This, in combination with the credentials provider allows the user to setup a server with ephemeral passwords, that requires periodic re-authentication with new credentials, in order to maintain a secure connection. An example of such an authentication scheme is AWS' [IAM](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/introduction.html)

A scheduler was added to the clients (Redis/Cluster) that runs reauth on configurable time.
The scheduler runs a callback in the clients to go over all the existing connections and send AUTH query on it.

In simple client, it runs AUTH over the connections, taking the credentials from the connection's connectionState.
It takes the credentials from each of the connection in order to support MasterReplica client as well.

In cluster client, it runs AUTH command on the existing connections in the connection provider and also on the default connection of the client. It takes the credentials from the client's FirstUri to AUTH all the existing connections.

This feature is disabled by default.
The default period between reauthentication attempts is 60 minutes.
", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/lettuce-io/lettuce-core/issues/2070/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'timeline_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/lettuce-io/lettuce-core/issues/2070/timeline', 'performed_via_github_app': None}, 'comment': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/lettuce-io/lettuce-core/issues/comments/1102158560', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/lettuce-io/lettuce-core/pull/2070#issuecomment-1102158560', 'issue_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/lettuce-io/lettuce-core/issues/2070', 'id': 1102158560, 'node_id': 'IC_kwDOASu1Js5BsZrg', 'user': {'login': 'mp911de', 'id': 1035015, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjEwMzUwMTU=', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/1035015?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/mp911de', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2022-04-19T06:51:38Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-19T06:51:38Z', 'author_association': 'MEMBER', 'body': "This doesn't sound as if it was a common use case. The easier approach would be to issue a `QUIT` command and rely on Lettuce's auto-reconnect feature.

Therefore, we do not want to incorporate the change that would introduce otherwise a lot of complexity.

Although there is a parser for PEM files already available (see `PemObject`), I introduced a new one called `PemReader`. This implementation has no dependencies to RSA. This seems to be reasonable because there are more algorithms available. Further I looked for a solution to add easily more private key implementations. The result was a `PrivateKeyFactory` which holds a list of private key strategies (`RsaPrivateKeyStrategy`, `EcPrivateKeyStrategy`).
`RsaPrivateKeyStrategy` is just a wrapper for `KeystoreUtil.getRSAPrivateKeySpec()`. 
To prove the concept, I quickly develop a `EcPrivateKeyStrategy`. That's why the support for EC is already present here. If you like to split these two features into separate PRs just give me a note.

Fixes gh-678

'https://api.github.com/users/abremora/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/abremora/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'site_admin': False}, 'body': "Support for PEM encoded certificates added. Although there is a parser for PEM files already available (see `PemObject`), I introduced a new one called `PemReader`. This implementation has no dependencies to RSA. This seems to be reasonable because there are more algorithms available. Further I looked for a solution to add easily more private key implementations. The result was a `PrivateKeyFactory` which holds a list of private key strategies (`RsaPrivateKeyStrategy`, `EcPrivateKeyStrategy`).
`RsaPrivateKeyStrategy` is just a wrapper for `KeystoreUtil.getRSAPrivateKeySpec()`. 
To prove the concept, I quickly develop a `EcPrivateKeyStrategy`. That's why the support for EC is already present here. If you like to split these two features into separate PRs just give me a note.

Fixes gh-678
Fixes gh-683", 'created_at': '2022-03-07T16:21:00Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-07T14:24:56Z', 'closed_at': None, 'merged_at': None, 'merge_commit_sha': 'd0a62fb571ae12ccb3f5e7deb6a79191cc1db88a', 'https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-vault/pull/688.diff', 'patch_url': 'https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-vault/pull/688.patch', 'merged_at': None}, 'body': "Support for PEM encoded certificates added. Although there is a parser for PEM files already available (see `PemObject`), I introduced a new one called `PemReader`. This implementation has no dependencies to RSA. This seems to be reasonable because there are more algorithms available. Further I looked for a solution to add easily more private key implementations. The result was a `PrivateKeyFactory` which holds a list of private key strategies (`RsaPrivateKeyStrategy`, `EcPrivateKeyStrategy`).
`RsaPrivateKeyStrategy` is just a wrapper for `KeystoreUtil.getRSAPrivateKeySpec()`. 
To prove the concept, I quickly develop a `EcPrivateKeyStrategy`. That's why the support for EC is already present here. If you like to split these two features into separate PRs just give me a note.

Fixes gh-678
Fixes gh-683", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-vault/issues/688/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'timeline_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-vault/issues/688/timeline', 'performed_via_github_app': None}, 'comment': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-vault/issues/comments/1091803531', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-vault/pull/688#issuecomment-1091803531', 'issue_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-projects/spring-vault/issues/688', 'id': 1091803531, 'node_id': 'IC_kwDOBBBbdc5BE5mL', 'user': {'login': 'mp911de', 'id': 1035015, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjEwMzUwMTU=', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/1035015?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/mp911de', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2022-04-07T14:20:52Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-07T14:20:52Z', 'author_association': 'MEMBER', 'body': "Thanks for your contribution. 'https://api.github.com/users/ctailor2/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/ctailor2/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/ctailor2/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/ctailor2/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/ctailor2/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'site_admin': False}, 'body': 'This is an extension of #1159 that further batches non-root insert actions across multiple aggregates via `CrudRepository#saveAll`.

The hope is that these changes pave the way for follow-on work to further batch:
1. root insert actions via `#saveAll`
2. non-root delete actions via `#saveAll`
3. non-root delete actions via `#deleteAll(Iterable<? extends T> entities)`

+package org.springframework.data.relational.core.conversion;
+
+/**
+ * Represents the changes happening to one or more aggregates (as used in the context of Domain Driven Design) as a
+ * whole. This change allows additional {@link MutableAggregateChange} of a particular kind to be merged into it to
+ * broadly represent the changes to multiple aggregates across all such merged changes.
+ *
+ * @author Chirag Tailor
+ * @since 3.0
+ */

2. non-root delete actions via `#saveAll`
3. non-root delete actions via `#deleteAll(Iterable<? extends T> entities)`
4. root delete actions via `#deleteAll(Iterable<? extends T> entities)`.

{'action': 'created', 'issue': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-cloud/spring-cloud-vault/issues/639', 'repository_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-cloud/spring-cloud-vault', 'labels_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-cloud/spring-cloud-vault/issues/639/labels{/name}', 'comments_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-cloud/spring-cloud-vault/issues/639/comments', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/spring-cloud/spring-cloud-vault/issues/639/events', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/spring-cloud/spring-cloud-vault/issues/639', 'id': 1194751848, 'node_id': 'I_kwDOAxGUsc5HNndo', 'number': 639, 'title': 'Add configuration option for X-Vault-Request header ', 'user': {'login': 'bt5e', 'id': 2256898, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjIyNTY4OTg=', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/2256898?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/bt5e', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/bt5e', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/bt5e/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/bt5e/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/bt5e/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/bt5e/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/bt5e/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/bt5e/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/bt5e/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/bt5e/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/bt5e/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'site_admin': False}, 'labels': [], 'state': 'open', 'locked': False, 'assignee': None, 'assignees': [], 'milestone': None, 'comments': 1, 'created_at': '2022-04-06T15:09:15Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-07T07:18:41Z', 'closed_at': None, 'author_association': 'NONE', 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': '**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When vault agent is configured to enforce X-Vault-Request header requirement, spring vault would error out with

`missing 'X-Vault-Request' header; nested exception is org.springframework.web.client.HttpClientErrorException: 412 Precondition Failed: "{"errors":["missing 'X-Vault-Request' header"]}<EOL>"`

**Describe the solution you'd like**
A configuration option to add the X-Vault-Request header in all requests to vault.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
We have turned off the X-Vault-Request header requirement from vault agent side for now.

**Additional context**

'open', 'locked': False, 'assignee': None, 'assignees': [], 'milestone': None, 'comments': 0, 'created_at': '2022-04-06T12:37:36Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-06T13:09:55Z', 'closed_at': None, 'author_association': 'NONE', 'active_lock_reason': None, 'draft': False, 'pull_request': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/lettuce-io/lettuce-core/pulls/2070', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/lettuce-io/lettuce-core/pull/2070', 'diff_url': 'https://github.com/lettuce-io/lettuce-core/pull/2070.diff', 'patch_url': 'https://github.com/lettuce-io/lettuce-core/pull/2070.patch', 'merged_at': None}, 'body': "Support for re-authentication.

This change allows the client to support automatic recurring reauthentication. This, in combination with the credentials provider allows the user to setup a server with ephemeral passwords, that requires periodic re-authentication with new credentials, in order to maintain a secure connection. An example of such an authentication scheme is AWS' [IAM](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/introduction.html)

A scheduler was added to the clients (Redis/Cluster) that runs reauth on configurable time.
The scheduler runs a callback in the clients to go over all the existing connections and send AUTH query on it.

In simple client, it runs AUTH over the connections, taking the credentials from the connection's connectionState.
It takes the credentials from each of the connection in order to support MasterReplica client as well.

In cluster client, it runs AUTH command on the existing connections in the connection provider and also on the default connection of the client. It takes the credentials from the client's FirstUri to AUTH all the existing connections.

This feature is disabled by default.
The default period between reauthentication attempts is 60 minutes.
", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/lettuce-io/lettuce-core/issues/2070/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'timeline_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/lettuce-io/lettuce-core/issues/2070/timeline', 'performed_via_github_app': None}, 'comment': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/lettuce-io/lettuce-core/issues/comments/1090251195', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/lettuce-io/lettuce-core/pull/2070#issuecomment-1090251195', 'issue_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/lettuce-io/lettuce-core/issues/2070', 'id': 1090251195, 'node_id': 'IC_kwDOASu1Js5A--m7', 'user': {'login': 'mp911de', 'id': 1035015, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjEwMzUwMTU=', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/1035015?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/mp911de', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mp911de/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2022-04-06T13:09:55Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-06T13:09:55Z', 'author_association': 'MEMBER', 'body': '> This change allows the client to support automatic recurring reauthentication. This, in combination with the credentials provider allows the user to setup a server with ephemeral passwords, that requires periodic re-authentication with new credentials, in order to maintain a secure connection

Can you elaborate on why re-authentication is necessary? Once a Redis connection is authenticated, it remains authenticated until disconnected. Updating the ACL does not de-authenticate a connection.', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/lettuce-io/lettuce-core/issues/comments/1090251195/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}}

'closed_at': '2022-04-06T07:00:51Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': 'Hello 


I have to use Postgres DB with CamlCase everywhere and it seems not supported 

When I save an entity : 

```       
val abc = Entities(0, "TestABC")
entitiesRepository.save(abc).block()
```

`org.springframework.r2dbc.BadSqlGrammarException: executeMany; bad SQL grammar [INSERT INTO common."Entities" (Name, Code) VALUES ($1, $2)]; nested exception is io.r2dbc.postgresql.ExceptionFactory$PostgresqlBadGrammarException: [42703] column "name" of relation "Entities" does not exist`


It should be`Name`, not `name`



And the Entity 

```
@Table(schema = "common", name = "\"Entities\"")
data class Entities(
    @Column("Id") @Id var id: Long = 0,
    @Column("Name") var name: String = "",
    @Column("Code") var code: String = "",
)
```



Also, I tried to add \\" in fields name :   
```
@Table(schema = "common", name = "\"Entities\"")
data class Entities(
    @Column("\"Id\"") @Id var id: Long = 0,
    @Column("\"Name\"") var name: String = "",
    @Column("\"Code\"") var code: String = "",
)
```


The save worked, but the findAll() return empty Entities 
`Entities(id=0, name=, code=)`


I try query 

`entitiesRepository.findByName("abc").blockFirst()`

and exception is 
```
io.r2dbc.postgresql.ExceptionFactory$PostgresqlBadGrammarException: column Entities.id does not exist
```
`id` should be `Id`



I use spring boot 3.0.0.M2, Kotlin 1.6, Jdk 17 and r2bcd 1.0.0.BUILD-SNAPSHOT

When using Spring Data, you can enable global quoting and configure a `NamingStrategy`, see https://docs.spring.io/spring-data/jdbc/docs/current/api/org/springframework/data/relational/core/mapping/RelationalMappingContext.html.

Closing this ticket as we cannot do on the driver level anything for you.', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/pgjdbc/r2dbc-postgresql/issues/comments/1089895028/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}}
